<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning.</strong> If you asked Alexa to “play Adele” this weekend, you were a part of history. Adele's new single “Easy on Me” received the most first-day Alexa song requests ever, Amazon Music said.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/the-first-bitcoin-etfs-are-set-for-launch?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bitcoin ETFs Are Here. But Will Anyone Bite?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/the-first-bitcoin-etfs-are-set-for-launch?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bitcoin as dollars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ff9b575748a839803d8cdae0d5389fb5992c6c56-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2013, the Winklevoss twins filed the <a href="https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2013/07/01/first-name-in-the-first-fund-for-bitcoins-winklevoss/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first application</a> for a bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF). Eight years and countless rejections later, the first bitcoin-based ETF could <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/first-u-s-bitcoin-etf-looks-set-to-debut-monday-or-tuesday-from-proshares-trust-11634333449?mod=mw_more_headlines" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">begin trading</a> as soon as today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The ETF, launched by the fund manager ProShares, will give virtually any investor with a brokerage account the ability to gain exposure to the world’s largest crypto.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>We didn’t say “buy the crypto,” because that’s not what’s happening. The bitcoin ETF is based on futures contracts, which allow investors to bet on the price swings of an underlying asset without owning it outright.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The SEC, Wall Street’s top sheriff, is much <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-bitcoin-etf-is-almost-here-what-does-that-mean-for-investors-11634376601?mod=hp_lista_pos4" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more comfortable</a> allowing a futures-based bitcoin ETF to proceed than one that directly buys the tokens. Bitcoin futures have been trading on the regulated Chicago Mercantile Exchange since 2017. Bitcoin itself, meanwhile, is bought and sold on many different exchanges that are outside the gaze of the SEC.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s unclear whether the ETF will be a hit</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The first mutual fund based on bitcoin futures, which launched in July, had only <a href="https://twitter.com/EricBalchunas/status/1443213956743630850?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1443213956743630850%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coindesk.com%2Fpolicy%2F2021%2F09%2F29%2Fgensler-reiterates-support-for-futures-based-bitcoin-etfs%2F" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$15 million</a> in assets under management two months later—basically negligible when put in the context of the $21.3 trillion US mutual fund industry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And the ETF news was received by some crypto professionals with a big “meh.” A bitcoin futures ETF <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/money-managers-race-to-launch-first-u-s-bitcoin-etf-after-sec-signal-11629451802?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">may not reliably track</a> bitcoin prices, while many investors are comfortable with the current options available for buying bitcoin. When asked by CNBC whether he would be investing in the ETF, bitcoin bull Mark Cuban <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/15/mark-cuban-says-he-wont-invest-in-a-potential-bitcoin-futures-etf.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>, “No. I can buy BTC directly.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>bitcoin’s price could be volatile in the next few weeks as four different bitcoin futures ETFs may begin trading this month.</p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEFENSE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/china-s-hypersonic-missile-launch-surprises-us-financial-times?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Surprise: China Launched a Hypersonic Missile
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/china-s-hypersonic-missile-launch-surprises-us-financial-times?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A Long March 5 rocket carrying China's Chang'e-5 lunar probe launches from the Wenchang Space Center on China's southern Hainan Island" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ecde6c105fc34785e1739647a80547248e60c6bf-1024x684.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>A Long March 5 rocket carrying China's Chang'e-5 lunar probe launches last November (STR/AFP via Getty Images)</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/ba0a3cde-719b-4040-93cb-a486e1f843fb?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> a nuclear-capable hypersonic missile in August that sped around the globe in low-Earth orbit before striking a target, according to the Financial Times.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If a “nuclear-capable hypersonic missile” sounds kinda scary to you, well...it sounds even scarier to US intelligence officials, who were completely taken off guard by China’s advancement in hypersonic weapons. “We have no idea how they did this,” one source told the FT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is a hypersonic missile? </strong>It’s a weapon that flies at 5x the speed of sound. That’s slower than a ballistic missile travels, but what makes hypersonic weapons more dangerous is that they can be manuevered during their flight—whereas ballistic missiles travel on a fixed parabola. Therefore, China could evade the US’ current defense systems and “execute a nuclear strike on any target on earth with near-impunity and very little warning,” according to <a href="https://www.thedrive.com/the-war-zone/42772/china-tested-a-fractional-orbital-bombardment-system-that-uses-a-hypersonic-glide-vehicle-report?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The War Zone</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>China’s hypersonic flex is the latest sign of its growing military ambitions. Tensions are building near Taiwan after China sent <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/us-canadian-warships-sailed-through-taiwan-strait-last-week-2021-10-17/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about 150 aircraft</a> into the democratically ruled island’s defense zone earlier this month.<br></p>
</div>

</a><span>  </span>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEIRD NEWS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/three-strange-headlines-from-the-weekend-s-news?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Three Bizarro-World Headlines
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/three-strange-headlines-from-the-weekend-s-news?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='A poster that says "Vienna strips on OnlyFans"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/02956f82bf15f702e8ae2f24cbb88384ae043a41-1166x938.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Vienna Tourism</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We usually save the world’s weirdest news stories for our Thursday game, but some headlines from this weekend were so wild we need to give you instant gratification.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. New OnlyFans account: </strong>And it’s not who you think. Vienna’s tourism board has created an account on OnlyFans to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/2021/oct/16/vienna-museums-open-adult-only-onlyfans-account-to-display-nudes?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">display nude artwork</a>, since other platforms like TikTok and Instagram block all depictions of nudity. In 2018, Facebook took down a photograph of a nude figurine that is 25,000 years old.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2.</strong> <strong style="color:#000">Illegal toppings:</strong> In what’s being dubbed “<a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/10/15/1046348573/sprinklegate-sinks-a-u-k-bakerys-top-sellers-after-topping-is-found-to-be-illega?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sprinklegate</a>,” a British bakery was forced to pull its bestselling cookies off of the market after being informed its sprinkles contained a coloring that’s not allowed to be used for sprinkles.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. An eye-opening author reveal: </strong>A popular Spanish author who goes by the pen name Carmen Mola was awarded the 1 million euro Planeta prize in literature. But when her name was called out during a ceremony on Friday, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/books/2021/oct/16/female-spanish-thriller-writer-carmen-mola-revealed-to-be-three-men?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three men</a>—TV script writers—revealed themselves as the actual authors behind Mola’s novels.</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOGETHER WITH NAADAM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Sweater Weather GOATs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://naadam.co/collections/morning-brew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=A" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Naadam" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/2240/1633034750-MB_STILL.jpg">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since literal goats in Mongolia’s Gobi Desert are the source of the <em>world’s best cashmere</em>, we’d say the acronym is fitting. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://naadam.co/collections/morning-brew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=A" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NAADAM</a> would know; they work directly with their herders to make unbelievably soft, sustainable cashmere clothing at prices that are fair for herders and sweater wearers alike.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And it’s about to get real comfy up in here, because<strong style="color:#000"> your favorite styles are back for fall 2021, including NAADAM’s Recycled Cashmere</strong>, made from 30% new cashmere and 70% recycled cashmere. It’s better for our planet, and gives that precious, leftover NAADAM yarn a second shot at keeping someone (hint hint: you) extra cozy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From stylish sets to kid’s cashmere to sneakers, you’ll be saying “Hot dang, NAADAM, you’ve done it again.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://naadam.co/collections/morning-brew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=A" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Use code MORNINGBREW20 for 20% off select items</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/key-performance-indicators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/key-performance-indicators?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez at the Met Gala" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f5e61bf7e74ff001916f963785ea79ee716a3858-1024x682.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ray Tamarra/GC Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The top 1% of households now hold a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-08/top-1-earners-hold-more-wealth-than-the-u-s-middle-class?sref=nXmOg68r" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">larger share of US wealth</a> (27%) than the entire middle class (26.6%) as of June, according to Federal Reserve data. It's the lowest share of national wealth held by the middle class—defined as the middle 60% of US households by income—on record.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“This is a Hollywood ending.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Matthew D. Loeb, the president of the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees (IATSE), celebrated a <a href="https://variety.com/2021/film/news/iatse-and-amptp-agreement-strike-averted-1235081349/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new deal</a> that averted a strike by 60,000 backstage film employees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Can America cope with demographic decline? (<a href="https://www.nationalreview.com/magazine/2021/10/18/can-america-cope-with-demographic-decline/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew#slide-1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">National Review</a>)</p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/the-week-ahead-october-18?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

</font></a>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">New tech gadgets: </strong>Fresh off its iPhone 13 launch, Apple is expected to unveil new MacBook Pro models at an event today, and possibly AirPods 3. On Tuesday, Google will also introduce its new smartphone, the Pixel 6.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>Banks kicked off earnings season <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/15/us-banks-crush-earnings-and-signal-more-good-times-ahead?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in style</a>, and now it’s up to companies like Netflix, Tesla, Snap, IBM, J&J, and AT&T to keep the party going this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">WeWork’s redemption: </strong>Everything collapsed for WeWork when it attempted to go public two years ago. It’ll try again this week in a SPAC deal that values it at $7.9 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Expect to hear a final decision from the FDA on boosters for Moderna’s and J&J’s vaccines, after a panel recommended them for certain populations last week.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Wars will be fought over TVs across America when both the NBA and </span><span><em>The Bachelorette </em></span><span>seasons begin Tuesday night.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Start reading the book now, because </span><span><em>Dune </em></span><span>is arriving in theaters on Friday.</span>
</li>
</ul>

But Will Anyone Bite?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/17/the-first-bitcoin-etfs-are-set-for-launch?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Bitcoin as dollars\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ff9b575748a839803d8cdae0d5389fb5992c6c56-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2013, the Winklevoss twins filed the \u003ca href=\"https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2013/07/01/first-name-in-the-first-fund-for-bitcoins-winklevoss/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst application\u003c/a\u003e for a bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF). Eight years and countless rejections later, the first bitcoin-based ETF could \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/first-u-s-bitcoin-etf-looks-set-to-debut-monday-or-tuesday-from-proshares-trust-11634333449?mod=mw_more_headlines\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebegin trading\u003c/a\u003e as soon as today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe ETF, launched by the fund manager ProShares, will give virtually any investor with a brokerage account the ability to gain exposure to the world’s largest crypto.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe didn’t say “buy the crypto,” because that’s not what’s happening. The bitcoin ETF is based on futures contracts, which allow investors to bet on the price swings of an underlying asset without owning it outright.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe SEC, Wall Street’s top sheriff, is much \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-bitcoin-etf-is-almost-here-what-does-that-mean-for-investors-11634376601?mod=hp_lista_pos4\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore comfortable\u003c/a\u003e allowing a futures-based bitcoin ETF to proceed than one that directly buys the tokens. Bitcoin futures have been trading on the regulated Chicago Mercantile Exchange since 2017. Bitcoin itself, meanwhile, is bought and sold on many different exchanges that are outside the gaze of the SEC.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s unclear whether the ETF will be a hit\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe first mutual fund based on bitcoin futures, which launched in July, had only \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/EricBalchunas/status/1443213956743630850?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1443213956743630850%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_\u0026ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coindesk.com%2Fpolicy%2F2021%2F09%2F29%2Fgensler-reiterates-support-for-futures-based-bitcoin-etfs%2F\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$15 million\u003c/a\u003e in assets under management two months later—basically negligible when put in the context of the $21.3 trillion US mutual fund industry.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd the ETF news was received by some crypto professionals with a big “meh.” A bitcoin futures ETF \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/money-managers-race-to-launch-first-u-s-bitcoin-etf-after-sec-signal-11629451802?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emay not reliably track\u003c/a\u003e bitcoin prices, while many investors are comfortable with the current options available for buying bitcoin. When asked by CNBC whether he would be investing in the ETF, bitcoin bull Mark Cuban \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/15/mark-cuban-says-he-wont-invest-in-a-potential-bitcoin-futures-etf.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e, “No. I can buy BTC directly.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ebitcoin’s price could be volatile in the next few weeks as four different bitcoin futures ETFs may begin trading this month.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e a nuclear-capable hypersonic missile in August that sped around the globe in low-Earth orbit before striking a target, according to the Financial Times.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf a “nuclear-capable hypersonic missile” sounds one source told the FT.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is a hypersonic missile? \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s a weapon that flies at 5x the speed of sound. That’s slower than a ballistic missile travels, but what makes hypersonic weapons more dangerous is that they can be manuevered during their flight—whereas ballistic missiles travel on a fixed parabola. Therefore, China could evade the US’ current defense systems and “execute a nuclear strike on any target on earth with near-impunity and very little warning,” according to \u003ca href=\"https://www.thedrive.com/the-war-zone/42772/china-tested-a-fractional-orbital-bombardment-system-that-uses-a-hypersonic-glide-vehicle-report?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe War Zone\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eChina’s hypersonic flex is the latest sign of its growing military ambitions. href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/books/2021/oct/16/female-spanish-thriller-writer-carmen-mola-revealed-to-be-three-men?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\"
